author: Michael Larabel
description: The controversial proposal to replace the upstream X.Org X11 server packages on Fedora Linux with XLibre is not going to happen... At least not for now. The change proposal has been withdrawn prior to being voted on by the Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee (FESCo)...
title: Proposal To Ship XLibre As X11 Server Packages On Fedora Linux Is Withdrawn

author: Michael Larabel
description: One of the interesting projects engaged in by Mozilla that directly wasn't related to their web browser efforts was DeepSpeech, an embedded/offline speech-to-text engine. To not much surprise given the lack of activity in recent years, last week they finally and formally discontinued the open-source project...
title: Mozilla Formally Discontinues Its DeepSpeech Project

author: Michael Larabel
description: The AMD EPYC 4005 "Grado"" processors launched by AMD in May for entry-level servers offer downright amazing value, performance, and power efficiency over the Intel Xeon 6300 / Xeon E-2400 series competition. Intel's top-of-stack Xeon 6300 (Xeon 6369P) / Xeon E processors fail to compete with even the mid-tier EPYC 4005 series processors in either performance, power, or cost effectiveness. Among the many advantages to these budget-friendly EPYC processors is having AVX-512 support with a full 512-bit data path compared to the Xeon 6300 series only having AVX2. For providing more insight into the AVX-512 performance impact with the AMD EPYC 4005 series, here are some enabled/disabled comparison benchmarks and how they are positioned relative to the Xeon 6369P server processor.
title: AVX-512's Enormous Advantage On AMD EPYC 4005 Series Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Mesa Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" has merged support for the VK_NV_cooperative_matrix2 NVIDIA Vulkan extension but it's hidden by default and only partially supported with a focus on helping FidelityFX Super Resolution 4 and VKD3D-Proton...
title: RADV Driver Introduces Limited Support For NVIDIA Cooperative Matrix Extension

author: Michael Larabel
description: Dutch electronics company Fairphone today announced their Fairphone Gen 6 smartphone as the successor to the Fairphone 5. Fairphone 6 continues to be repair-friendly and was just announced this morning while already the Linux support patches have hit the Linux kernel mailing list...
title: Fairphone 6 Announced With Same-Day Linux Support Patches

author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel open-source software projects are beginning to relay notices that they may have been developed with support from Intel-operated generative AI solutions...
title: Intel Open-Source Software Begins Adding Notices For Generative AI Use

author: Michael Larabel
description: While WebP and AVIF generate much of the interest these days from a tech perspective for modern image formats, the PNG image format was just updated with new features...
title: PNG Spec Updated For HDR Images & Animated PNGs
